data.name: Lager Diabla
data.description: Lager Diabla is an exceptionally easy drinking California lager that is lightly bodied with a clean/crisp finish.

style.name: American-Style Lager
style.description: Light in body and very light to straw in color, American lagers are very clean and crisp and aggressively carbonated. Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Devil's Canyon Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Devil’s Canyon Brewing Company, located in the heart of the San Francisco bay area peninsula, produces award-winning, sustainably handcrafted beer and root beer centered on the most premium ingredients.

Prior to the 1780’s the canyon portion of Belmont and San Carlos was known as “la Canada del Diablo” or Devil’s Canyon.

Since opening our doors in 2001, Devil’s Canyon Brewing Co. has won over 35 awards for our craft beers. San Francisco Bay Area A-List readers voted Devil’s Canyon “Favorite Bay Area Brewery” in 2013 and “Best Bay Area Beer Bar” in 2014. San Francisco Business Journal readers voted Devil’s Canyon “Best Beer” in 2014. Also in 2014, the brewery was awarded “Business of the Year” by the City of San Carlos and the San Carlos Chamber of Commerce.

data.name: Lagereida
data.description: Somewhere between a North German Pils and a Dortmund Lager, Lagereida is a clean lager beer with biscuity maltiness, a peppery hop nose and subtle skunky character. A sort of "parti-gyle" brew, the recipe was developed on the fly when there were 15 barrels worth of second runnings from a Lovely Reida batch that had nowhere to go.

style.name: American-Style Lager

Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Georgetown Brewing Company
breweries.description: Georgetown Brewing Company, a Seattle microbrewery and brewer of Manny's Pale Ale. We're a draft beer only production brewery, which means that all we do is make beer and fill kegs. Sorry, no brewpub, but we do have a retail shop where you can pick up kegs to go, growlers, and perhaps get a taste of our newest beer before it's released. Or you could be social and get out to your favorite local watering hole. If they don't have our beer on tap, let us know and we'll do our best to pester 'em into submission. Do we bottle? Not yet but we never say never. Right now we're focused on doing one thing right... draft beer. Cheers!

breweries.name: Capital Brewery
breweries.description:
Located in a former egg processing plant building, Capital Brewery produced its first brew at 6:30 pm, April 17, 1986.

The brewhouse features two copper brewing kettles. These units, now over 50 years old, were originally used at the former Hoxter Brewery located in Germany.

At the heart of the operation is a group of loyal and hard working employees dedicated to producing the high quality beer that Capital Brewery is known for.

Most of the beers brewed here at Capital consist of traditional ingredients, water, malted barley and wheat, hops and yeast. However, we do believe in experimentation to develop unique beer styles and varieties. We invite you to enjoy one of our beers in our brewery or take some home for a true Capital experience.


Capital Brewery was established with an important mission in mind, and we continually build on that sentiment, by delivering a unique experience and award winning beers to meet the changing demands of the craft beer community.

data.name: Lakeboat Lager
data.description: Cannery Brewing's Lakeboat Lager is a tribute to the S.S. Sicamous. The S.S. Sicamous is a unique historical landmark in Penticton. Operational from 1914 until 1935, today it is the largest of four steam-driven stern wheeled lake vessels that have been restored in Canada. The mellow malts and exciting hops of this lager are carefully balanced to produce a crisp, clean, refreshing finish.

breweries.name: Cannery Brewing
breweries.description:
Located amidst the breathtaking scenery of Penticton, British Columbia, Canada, our micro-brewery produces individually crafted fine ales and lagers of unmistakable complexity and balance. This flavour is the result of wonderful combinations of premium quality malted grains and carefully chosen Pacific Northwest hops.

All of our beers are created with carefully selected and scrutinized ingredients. We use the finest hops and grains and only the finest yeast strains. Our brews are all natural. They contain no preservatives and are not pasteurized. You get a fresh, crisp taste every time.

breweries.name: Lakemaid Beer
breweries.description: Wherever anglers gather, you’re bound to hear great stories. One of the better known and sworn-to-be-true is the story of the Lakemaids. Long ago, these freshwater mermaids found their way inland from the oceans, down the St. Lawrence Seaway and up the Mississippi, to summer in the cool, pure waters of the North Country. Each year, on the night of the Summer Solstice, they reward anglers who have kept their lakes pure, with ice cold Lakemaid Beer, made fresh from the deepest, purest water they can find.

data.name: Landrun lager
data.description:
Land Run is the lightest brew we make. Very crisp and clean tasting, Land Run is delicately hopped for an extra smooth finish. Lagers take longer to ferment than ales (30 days), so we are not able to have this on tap all the time.

Grain: 2 Row, Pilsen, Munich 10
Hops: Nugget, Saaz

breweries.name: Bricktown Brewery (OKC)

Bricktown Brewery opened in October 1992, making history, quality beers, and great food. This started what has become the most unique setting and entertainment establishment in Oklahoma City!

In keeping with the Brewery’s standard of providing our patrons with an exceptional experience, we have transformed the historical turn-of-the century building into a great place to find award winning beers, great food, and plenty of fun for all ages!

data.name: Lashes
data.description: This Red IPL balances an assertive Munich Malt character with an infusion of Super Styrian, Columbus, and Palisades hops. It’s full-bodied and malty with a hop aroma that’s both spicy and piney. The lager’s beautiful amber hue takes after our head brewer’s luscious lashes.

breweries.name: Jack's Abby Brewing
breweries.description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

breweries.name: Utah Brewers Cooperative
breweries.description:
Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee, America’s beer capital, only to discover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

In fact, it was Schirf who proposed the bill to the Utah Legislature in 1988 that would make brew pubs legal in Utah. There are now more than 12 thriving brew pubs in the state thanks to Schirf and the bill's sponsor, Senator Mike Demeitrick of Price, Utah.

data.name: Laughfest Honey Lager
data.description: The official knee slappin’ beer of Laughfest is back. This year we brewed a lager tickled with Michigan wildflower honey and chuckled it full of Cascade and Mandirina hops that make this beer giggle with orange appeal.

breweries.name: Big E Ales
breweries.description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.

data.name: Lazy River
data.description: This laid back lager is a pre-prohibition classic with a unique quality.  A gentle graininess and corn sweetness blend with premium aroma hops from Oregon’s Willamette Valley and the Czech Republic.  One satisfying beverage for any occasion, any day, any time.

breweries.name: Sunriver Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We love our beer. In a region that has taken microbrews to a whole new level, we pride ourselves on brewing awesome craft beer that includes the lighter side of brewing as well as the killer hoppy fare.

We’re just as proud of our outrageous service. Great beer needs to be shared. We’re positioned to do just that here in Sunriver and beyond. Whether we’re serving customers in our brewpub or working with our distributors and their outlets, our awesome beers are brewed to be relished. You’ll crave our high-quality, easy-drinking beer and we’ll do whatever it takes to share the love.

data.name: Leisure Time
data.description: Leisure Time uses locally sourced ingredients to create a beer worth kicking your feet up with. Leisure Time is brewed with wheat and a blend of spices including lemongrass, coriander, orange peel, and chamomile. A subtle spiciness balances the citrusy and floral hops added to the whirl and hopback. Hop in your comfy armchair and enjoy!

data.name: Lhasa Beer
data.description: Lhasa Beer is the first beer anywhere in the world to use the type of barley native to the Tibetan plateau in the modern brewing process. This ground breaking development is the innovation of Master Brewer Alan Kornhauser. He is a repeat winner of multiple gold medals at the Great American Beer Festival and has worked in many different breweries, large and small,domestically and overseas. He specially re-formulated Lhasa Beer for export to discerning beer drinkers around the world. It is carefully crafted it to take advantage of the unique characteristics of Tibetan barley while minimizing the problems that its use presents in the brewing process.

breweries.name: Tibet Lhasa Brewery Company
breweries.description: The Tibet Lhasa Brewery Company Ltd. in Lhasa, Tibet is the world’s highest commercial brewery located at 11,975 feet in elevation and it is the only one in the Tibetan Autonomous Region. The brewery is a joint venture equally owned by a domestic corporation and a Danish investment led by The Carlsberg Group, one of the world’s largest brewers. It produces 85% of all beer sold in Tibet. It is the sole source of Lhasa Beer, “Beer from the Roof Of The World.”

breweries.name: Lenny Boy Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Lenny Boy was founded in 2011 with an interest in a healthy lifestyle, a passion for fermentation and an obsession with brewing. The company started off producing non-alcoholic kombucha with one 7 bbl fermenting tank. In 2012, we stumbled upon our current facility in the historic SouthEnd district in Charlotte, NC. In January of 2013 Lenny Boy became the only Certified Organic kombucha producer in the Southeast! In September 2013, we took it a step further and became a licensed microbrewery.  In doing so, we became the only certified organic brewery North Carolina! The new license allowed us to diversify our product line, which now includes kombucha, wild ales, and traditional beers. We currently produce 100 bbl of kombucha every month and have a 7 bbl traditional beer brewing system. Our kombucha can be found from Virginia to Alabama and our beers are currently within North Carolina.  ENJOY!

breweries.name: Hop Valley Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Founded in February, 2009, Hop Valley is the first craft brewery in Springfield, OR.  With a 15 barrel system and a restaurant that compliments the fine hand crafted beer, Hop Valley has grown into one of Springfield's largest businesses.  Distributing beer throughout the Western States.
Based on that success, and significant pent up demand for their beer, Hop Valley opened a new facility at 990 W.1st Ave in Eugene at which they have built a new, much larger, 60 barrel production brewery.  This facility will be capable of producing up to 100,000 barrels per year, in stark contrast to the system in Springfield, that is maxed out at about 4000 barrels produced in 2012.
Our state of the art equipment and the facility are all built with every opportunity toward a green foot print, including the most efficient lighting, boiler, solar heating, etc.. available today.
The new facility has a large tasting room and outdoor patio and also has limited food service, to allow customers to enjoy all of our craft brews in a very comfortable setting, and with enough parking and outdoor area to support large parties!

breweries.name: Wet Dog Cafe & Astoria Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Wet Dog Café was founded in 1995. The Brewery was added in 1997 under the name Pacific Rim Brewery. The name of the Brewery was changed to Astoria Brewing Co. in 2005 to commemorate Astoria’s First Brewing Company which was established in 1872. The Wet Dog was named after….the original owners dog…he loved the water and was always WET.

Our Brew Master uses only the finest ingredients to create our exceptional beers. Each beer is handcrafted using a wide range of hops & grains, thus creating unique flavors. It takes approximately 2 weeks for grain, water & hops to become our tasty brews. Our brewery has a 4 barrel system & in 2008 we added two 8 barrel fermenting tanks allowing us to produce over 800 barrels annually.

data.description: Lion lager is the number one lager brand in Sri Lanka. It echoes the pride of a nation which has the Lion as a symbol on the national flag. It is a European style lager brewed with the finest malt and hops which originate in Europe. Brewed to 4.8% ABV it is rich and flavorful in the style of a traditional German lager.

data.name: Liquid Local Legends Vol. 1: J. Roddy Walston and The Business
data.nameDisplay: Liquid Local Legends Vol. 1: J. Roddy Walston and The Business
data.description: The first installment in the Liquid Local Legends (3XL) draft series is Sweat Shock Malt Liquor, a tribute brew to one of our all-time favorite Baltimore bands, J Roddy Walston and The Business. Our goal with this beer was to pay tribute to what we love about the band – loud, sweaty, raucous, good old American rock and roll that elevates the sounds of the American landscape to make something exciting, new and yet immediately classic. We’ve taken all the ingredients that make up the classic mass-produced malt liquors – barley, rice, & corn – and elevated the recipe to produce a premium imperial lager truly worth savoring.

style.name: American-Style Lager
style.description: Light in body and very light to straw in color, American lagers are very clean and crisp and aggressively carbonated. Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Union Craft Brewing Company
breweries.description: Union Craft Brewing is a homegrown, independent craft brewery located in the Clipper Mill area of Woodberry. We are dedicated to providing the good people of Baltimore fresh, handcrafted, and approachable beers and to fostering the community that forms whenever great beer is flowing.

data.name: Local Lager
data.description: A crisp, clean, easy drinking lager. Unlike most mass produced commercial lagers, this craft lager is all grain with no corn or rice added. We take pride in presenting a low hopped, light, easy drinking beer made in the tradition of an old American Lager. For the local and weekend warrior alike!

style.name: American-Style Lager
style.description: Light in body and very light to straw in color, American lagers are very clean and crisp and aggressively carbonated. Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Tahoe Mountain Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are a craft brewery in Truckee and Tahoe City, CA. Our brew pub is in downtown Tahoe City, right on the shore of Lake Tahoe across from Commons Beach. In addition to our specialty ales and lagers, we have a full bar and full menu featuring smokehouse BBQ meats, wood-fired flat bread pizzas, fish, pasta, gourmet and traditional pub faire as well as innovative dishes such as our Cajun Seared Ahi Nachos. We have vegan/vegetarian options, the pub is family friendly and has a kids menu. The pub also has outdoor patio seating, a full bar and a great rustic interior set among our collection of french oak barrels with aging beer.

data.name: Local Logger Lager
data.description: A light and crisp unfiltered lager spiced with Saaz and Golding hops.  Brewed to refresh!

data.name: Local's
data.description:
Local’s is a light, yet very tasty lager. The light pilsen malt creates a soft and subtle flavor profile that finishes crisp and clean on your palate.
Local’s is a perfect beer for the seasoned craft brew enthusiast and someone new to microbrews. When Short’s first opened, there was not a great deal of craft beer available in the area. Joe Short wanted to create a beer that would appeal to new craft beer drinkers who lived in Michigan, and introduce them to the complex flavors of other beer styles.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Lager

breweries.name: Short's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.

data.name: Lodestone Lager
data.description:
Munich-style pale lager with a malty sweetness balanced by Noble hops with subtle spicy hop notes in the nose. Finishes clean and dry.
Awards: 2000 GABF Bronze Medal; 1997 GABF Gold Medal.

breweries.name: Iron Hill Brewery
breweries.description:
Welcome to Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant, where you'll find fine handcrafted beers, creative yet informal cuisine, and friendly, attentive service in a casual, upscale atmosphere.

We're passionate about producing distinctive, full-flavored handcrafted beers, accompanied by fresh–from–scratch New American cuisine in a comfortable, casual atmosphere. Our goal has always been to provide food and beer that is inspired, consistently crafted and presented by a knowledgeable and courteous service staff.

Our commitment to support the communities in which we do business goes to the heart of what differentiates Iron Hill from other restaurants. But it is because of you, our guests, that we have been able to make this all happen.

data.name: Long Day Lager
data.description: A Bohemian style pilsener that is slightly deeper amber than most in this style. It has somewhat sweet with biscuit like malty notes. We've used some noble hops but have definitely put our American twist on it with a subtle citrusy aroma and a little bit more alcohol than normal. We hope people will find this lager refreshing after having a long hard day.

breweries.name: Red Hare Brewing Company
breweries.description: Situated in an 11,000 sq. ft. warehouse, Red Hare Brewing Company has a 20 barrel brewhouse with a 120 barrel fermenting capacity. Making every day beer for beer fans everywhere, Red Hare’s flagship beer is Long Day Lager. Other year round Red Hare beers are Gangway IPA and Watership Brown. Keep an eye out for our Rabbit’s Reserve Series, limited edition, one-off batches that will be released four times a year.

data.name: Longbeard Winter Wheat Lager
data.description: A unique American Lager, almost black with a nice mahogany head, the large dose of wheat gives Longbeard body but allows it a light taste. The dark roasted malt gives way to a slight wooden note and makes this dark beer almost drink light. Designed for the between season when winter gives way to spring.

breweries.name: Bank Brewing Company
breweries.description: With the construction of our very own brewery in Hendricks, the sun is rising on new opportunities. Located in rural Western Minnesota, our focus will be two-fold. Our taproom that is located in an old bank building on Main Street will be full of faithful local patrons but we are also a destination brewery for the region. The new brewery brings new beer to our lineup. Ales will dominate and hops will be used to extreme proportions. This new lineup of beer will appeal to the craft beer lovers who are seeking out big, flavorful beer but of course we will have a some that appeal to the masses as well. Our brewery operations are housed in a beautiful historic creamery building and the taproom is in an old bank. Our second effort is on distribution through kegs at pubs and liquor stores in the area.

data.name: Longship Lager
data.description: It's hard to call this anything except a STRONG Viking Lager. Brewed after Northern Tradition, with Tetanaug Hops, our Longship is surprising smooth, and frighteningly Strong.

breweries.name: Dempsey's Brewpub
breweries.description:
Cead Mile Failte! Dempseys Brewery Restaurant & Pub

 We are a local family owned restaurant, with an on-site micro-brewery (2nd oldest in the state!) and we have been in business for over 15 years! 

We specialize in european/american style food, with about 85% of all of our items made from scratch. Executive Chef Se'an Dempsey is also the only Certified Pizzioloia in South Dakota, as a recent graduate of the Scullo Italiana Pizzaioli in San Francisco.

We also feature the ONLY Brick Oven in Watertown!

data.name: Lookout Mountain Lager
data.description: German pilsen malt and traditional noble European hops. Basically a clean American Lager/Pilsner/Keller Bier without rice or corn in the recipe. Our refreshing non-threatening gateway beer that proves that sometimes the simple classics are best.

breweries.name: Moccasin Bend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Moccasin Bend Brewing Company is located in the historic St. Elmo district of Chattanooga, TN.  We’re at the foot of Lookout Mountain just steps away from the world-famous Incline Railway and very near to the great Moccasin Bend of the Tennessee River. 

MBBC was started by two brewers whose quest for the perfect beer led them to learn the art of brewing.  Chris Hunt and Duncan Guy began their brewing education in the Barley Mob Brewers homebrewing club and continued to search for unique and distinctive ale and lager formulas. They decided to offer their creations to the public through a small batch microbrewery in 2006.  Soon thereafter, award-winning brewer Courtney Tyvand joined the two and presented his smoked porter at the brewery’s first beer dinner in October of 2006.

The brewery is located on the ground floor of a historic building at 4015 Tennessee Avenue in St. Elmo.  The building is constructed of foot-square cedar timbers and two-foot thick walls made of granite stone and mortar.  Built in 1911 as a packaging factory for K-Rations for WWI, we occasionally find artifacts from that era in the building walls and ceiling.  The brewery shares space with the Chattanooga U-Brew, a brew-on-premises business owned by Greg McCort. 

MBBC is proud to offer small batch specialty ales and lagers in kegs of various sizes.  A tasting room is part of the brewery; samples of our beers can be tasted and tested on premises.  Occasionally we have tasting events or tapping events at the brewery or at a nearby bar or restaurant.  Please check our calendar for scheduled tasting events at the brewery.

data.name: Loose Tongue Lager
data.description: American Lager blended with a bit of Czech pils style. Smooth, sweet and a bit more chewy than your traditional lager. Noble hops with a bit of American citrus twist. Clean crisp lager finish with a bit of grassy linger.

breweries.name: Crow Hop Brewing Co
breweries.description: The main brewing philosophy of Crow Hop is to create well-balanced recipes that highlight each of beer's classic ingredients. Our seven core beers represent this philosophy, whereas our rotating selections give our brewers' creativity a chance to shine, in particular our Monthly Micro-fest. Each month, we release three to six pilot batches brewed around a common theme, from fruit beers to IPAs to a high gravity series - nothing is off limits. We strive to have products on hand that will excite and satisfy all kinds of beer lovers because for us at Crow Hop Brewing, it's about the beer.

breweries.name: EPIC Brewing Company
breweries.description:
EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO.  

In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.

breweries.name: Bluegrass Brewing Company
breweries.description: The original Bluegrass Brewing Company opened in 1993 at this location, 3929 Shelbyville Road, near Westport Rd., & Chenoweth, & Breckenridge Lanes. It is the city's oldest remaining brewpub and was the first to make a significant mark on the national brewpub and microbrewery scene. Louisville's best beer is made at this location, and large glass windows in the back dining room allow you to witness the brewing operation. The headbrewer is Jerry Gnagy, assisted by Sam Cruz and Cody Mingus.

data.name: Louisville Lager
data.description: Goodwood Louisville Lager is the first and only beer brewed with 100% Kentucky-grown grains. And, in a tip of the cap to our Slugger-making neighbors downtown, white ash – common in baseball bats – is used to enhance brewing. This results in a light-bodied, perfectly balanced lager with a sweet finish delivered by those Kentucky grains.

style.name: American-Style Lager
style.description: Light in body and very light to straw in color, American lagers are very clean and crisp and aggressively carbonated. Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Goodwood Brewing
breweries.description:
The gents behind Goodwood are 3 of Louisville’s longest-serving brewing veterans, running production breweries here since 2001. Now thrilled to branch off on their own, this splinter group of beer makers has rebooted their brewery around the success of its renowned product: BBC Bourbon Barrel Stout, (now Goodwood Bourbon Barrel Stout.) To that end, Goodwood’s "shade-grown beers" are all touched by the natural gradations of reclaimed casks and other wood-types for flavorful expressions that are unique to the Goodwood.

Get lost in the wood.
Why take the extra time to wood-age beer? Why insist on the same pure, limestone water used to make bourbon? Well here at Goodwood, we've come to believe that what's good for the bourbon is even better for beer. Our extra steps are kind of an homage to this region's distilling legacy and to those old barrels out there that still have so much flavor left to give. sip one of our freshly nuanced stouts, lagers, or ales, and we believe you'll think so , too.

breweries.name: Motor Row Brewing
breweries.description: 10 BBL brew house located on Historic Motor Row on the near South Side of Chicago. The breweries main focus are on lagers and Belgian style ales. It is a draft only brewery with distribution throughout the Chicagoland area. There is an on-site tasting and tap room open 5 days a week from Wednesday through Sunday.

breweries.name: Pearl Street Brewery
breweries.description:
Our brewery started with a dream and a 1984 Eagle Wagon and trailer packed with brewery equipment driven here from Colorado by an ambitious young brewer and his Dad. After a long and tumultuous journey involving disaster and triumph;  joy and heartache ~  they began to build. Following fourteen months of design, building and construction they finally fired up the brew kettle for the first time in December of 1999. Although the brewery was tiny and tucked in a basement on Pearl Street, the celebration and Grand Opening was enough to attract throngs of flavor starved people and get Mayor Medinger to tap the inaugural keg.

We have come a long way since. Today we brew, bottle and keg our beers from our new home in the historic La Crosse Footwear building with our expanded 30 barrel brewery. The new brewery has over six times the brewing capacity of the old Pearl Street Brewhouse. And while we spent the first 8 years slinging brews out to nearby pubs and restaurants in draught kegs only, in July of 2007, we unveiled bottled beer in six packs and cases.

data.name: Lumberjack India Pale Lager
data.description: Our passion for Northwest IPAs and German-style lagers are combined in this new favorite: Limberjack IPL. A crisp, clean lager can be the perfect compliment to a well balanced hop profile. Because lagers can be more time consuming, most brewers choose ale yeasts for their hop forward beers. Try this to see what you've been missing...

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

data.description: Mine is made from extracts of malt and hops by using our advanced brewing technology. It has refined aroma of malt and lingering finish.

style.name: American-Style Lager
style.description: Light in body and very light to straw in color, American lagers are very clean and crisp and aggressively carbonated. Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.
